dublin_core.dcvalue: This article describes rates of missing item responses in personal digital assistant PDA assessments as compared to paper assessments Data come from the evaluation of a classroom based leisure life skills and sexuality education program delivered to high school students in Cape Town South Africa Analyses show that the paper assessments had much higher rates of missing ness than PDA assessments This association is moderated by item order Certain analyses also suggest that paper assessments have higher rates of missingness for items pertaining to participants sexual behavior Implications of these results for evaluation research will be discussed
Rates of missing responses in personal digital assistant (PDA) versus paper assessments.
